info.description: The ESG Data API offers a centralized source of ESG data and meta data across multiple vendors. The API retrieves ESG data by asset and issuer from multiple vendors, providing the data in one digestible schema. Retrieve ESG data for selected assets and issuers by providing entity id, provider id, date(s) and measure name. Meta data on ESG data measures can be retrieved by selecting a provider, provider category and unique measure names. Time Series API in alpha version, changes may be made at any time.
info.title: ESG Data

parameters.description: Provider setting for the list of measures.  Examples = MSCI, SUST, ISS, REFINITIV, CLARITY_AI.
parameters.name: providerId

parameters.description: Category setting for the list of measures. Example : `ESG`.
parameters.name: providerCategory

parameters.description: Optional list of measures.  If empty, will return all available measures for the source/category. Example : `ESG_IA_SCORE,ESG_FINAL_RATING`.
parameters.name: measures

Any.description:
`Any` contains an arbitrary serialized message along with a
URL that describes the type of the serialized message

@type.description: A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized message.

rpcStatus.description:
The `Status` type defines a logical error model that is suitable for
different programming environments, including REST APIs and RPC APIs. It is
used by [gRPC](https://github.com/grpc). Each `Status` message contains
three pieces of data: error code, error message, and error details.

You can find out more about this error model and how to work with it in the
[API Design Guide](https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/errors).

code.description: The status code, which should be an enum value of [google.rpc.Code][google.rpc.Code].

message.description:
A developer-facing error message, which should be in English. Any
user-facing error message should be localized and sent in the
[google.rpc.Status.details][google.rpc.Status.details] field, or localized by the client.

details.description:
A list of messages that carry the error details.  There is a common set of
message types for APIs to use.

typesAnalyticDataValue.title: Wrapper for security analytic value which could be one of many data types

valueString.title: This field stores the data when it's in string data type

valueNumeric.title: This field stores the data when it's in a numeric data type

valueInteger.title: This field stores the data when it's in a integer data type

valueDate.title: This field stores the data when it's in date data type

v1DataType.description:
enum for measure datatypes.

 - DATA_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: Unspecified data type
 - DATA_TYPE_STRING: String based data
 - DATA_TYPE_NUMERIC: Numeric based data
 - DATA_TYPE_DATE: Date/time data
 - DATA_TYPE_INTEGER: Integer based data

idType.title: Type of identifier, for BLK issuers id_type == ESG_ID_TYPE_ALADDIN_ISSUER

v1ESGDataSetResponse.title: The response message for EsgDataAPI.RetrieveEsgDataAsOfDate & EsgDataAPI.RetrieveEsgDataTimeSeries

nextPageToken.description:
A token, which can be sent as `page_token` to retrieve the next page.
If this field is omitted, there are no subsequent pages.

v1ESGException.description:
(-- api-linter: aladdin::0901::dictionary-message-field=disabled
aip.dev/not-precedent: We can't change IdType name as this will break existing API --)
Exception response to request client.

idType.title: Type of identifier, for BLK issuers id_type == ESG_ID_TYPE_ALADDIN_ISSUER

providerMeasure.title: ESG data provider & measures with exception

v1ESGMeasurement.title: Measurement message that describes the measurement field name and the value

v1ESGMetadataResponse.description: Response message for ESG Entitlements/Metadata API.

providerId.description: Source setting for the list of measures.

providerCategory.description: Category setting for the list of measures.

v1ESGProviderDataPoint.title: Data points corresponding to each provider

asOfDate.title: as of date for data points

parentIssuerId.title: id of the parent issuer, if traversal was done

issuerTraversal.title: indicates whether traversal for parent issuer was done to get the ESG data

v1IdType.description:
- ID_TYPE_UNSPECIFIED: Default Value - Error is thrown in this case
 - ID_TYPE_ALADDIN_ISSUER: ALADDIN_ISSUER - The id is an Aladdin issuer
 - ID_TYPE_ASSET_ID: ASSET_ID - This id is the id of the asset, could be a cusip, z_cusip
or any other thing along those lines
v1IdType.title: Type of the ID that is being passed

v1ProviderMeasure.title: The message to hold the provider details and the measures to be fetched

providerId.title: Id/name of the provider. Examples = MSCI, SUST, ISS, REFINITIV, CLARITY_AI

v1ProviderMeasureMetadata.description: Measure dataset response to request client.

measureExt.title:
Extension object for provider specific metadata.
(-- api-linter: core::0144::message-field-plural=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: Naming as plural is not necessary.  --)

v1ProviderMeasureMetadataExt.title:
Extension object containing key/value pair data
Sample data for key = EDS: measure_xref_id, split_adjusted, etc

v1ReportFrequency.description:
- REPORT_FREQUENCY_UNSPECIFIED: Default Value - will return any data available in time range without any modifications
 - REPORT_FREQUENCY_WEEKLY: Weekly - return data split into weeks based on the time range
 - REPORT_FREQUENCY_MONTHLY: Monthly - return data split into months based on the time range
 - REPORT_FREQUENCY_QUARTERLY: Quarterly - return data split into quarters based on the time range
 - REPORT_FREQUENCY_ANNUALLY: Annually - return data split into years based on the time range
v1ReportFrequency.title: Report frequency period for time series data

ids.title: Names of the identifiers. Example : `S60180858, SB3NB1P28`

asOfDate.title: Date for which the data needs to be provided (`YYYY-MM-DD`). Example : `2021-08-17`

providerMeasures.title: Details of measures to be provided per provider. Example : `{"measures": ["ESG_IA_SCORE", "ESG_FINAL_RATING"],"providerId": "MSCI"}`

issuerTraversal.description: Should parent issuer traversal be done. NOTE: This feature is in ALPHA phase.

pageSize.title:
Maximum number of ids for which data will be returned in each
response. If unspecified, limit is set to the default maximum.
Values above this will be coerced to this maximum.
The maximum value is outlined in API documentation, as well as in BLK token ESG_ID_LIMIT

pageToken.description:
A page token, received from a previous `RetrieveEsgDataAsOfDateRequest` call.
Provide this to retrieve the subsequent page.

When paginating, all other parameters provided to
`RetrieveEsgDataAsOfDateRequest` must match the call that provided the
page token.

ignoreDefaultIssuerTraversal.title:
Should the default value, defined at provider level, be ignored for parent issuer traversal.
(-- api-linter: core::0132::request-unknown-fields=disabled
    aip.dev/not-precedent: We really need this field because we want to add this field as part of the request, along with other fields --)

ids.title: Names of the identifiers. Example : `S60180858, SB3NB1P28`

fromDate.title:
Start date for time series data that needs to be provided (`YYYY-MM-DD`). Example : `2021-08-17`
(-- api-linter: core::0140::prepositions=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because we need to make the API more user friendly --)

toDate.title:
End date for time series data that needs to be provided (`YYYY-MM-DD`). Example : `2021-09-24`
(-- api-linter: core::0140::prepositions=disabled
 aip.dev/not-precedent: We need to do this because we need to make the API more user friendly --)

providerId.title: Id/name of the provider.  Examples = MSCI, SUST, ISS, REFINITIV, CLARITY_AI

rollupFlag.title: To include all measures in list in one time series, set to true. Default is false

period.title: Frequency of time series data returned

pageSize.title:
Maximum number of ids for which data will be returned in each
response. If unspecified, limit is set to the default maximum.
Values above this will be coerced to this maximum.
The maximum value is outlined in API documentation, as well as in BLK token ESG_TIME_SERIES_ID_LIMIT

pageToken.description:
A page token, received from a previous `RetrieveEsgDataTimeSeriesRequest` call.
Provide this to retrieve the subsequent page.

When paginating, all other parameters provided to
`RetrieveEsgDataTimeSeriesRequest` must match the call that provided the
page token.

OAuth2AccessCode.description: This API uses OAuth 2.0 with the access code flow.

scopes.offline_access: This keeps you signed in to the app, even when you are not using it.

OAuth2ClientCredentials.description: This API uses OAuth 2.0 with the client credentials flow.

scopes.offline_access: This keeps you signed in to the app, even when you are not using it.
